author: Falconhood
title: finally...HANDS!
review:
i am NOT into bionicles, so this is outside fan-reviews, but i bought this so i can copy the HANDS for previous Bionicles i bought(larger ones), and use scrap from those little ones for hands.
very nice kit

author: DarkLordMakuta
title: Freaking cool!
review: Axonn is by far my favourite titan set to date! There is not a single thing bad to say about him. Although he is a tad short, his height and axe make him very Dwarf-like, and NOBODY tosses a Dwarf! His hands are quite cool, and his axe is awesome. I recommend this set to anyone who... well, anyone. BUY AXONN!

author: smiley905
title: best bionicle i own (and thats saying somthing)
review: this set is awsome, it fingers are realy cool just because its a change for bionicles. i love the axe and the helmate and the rest is good too. also, the chest is realy nice how they added those pieces under the shoulder. i would definitly recomend this set to anyone

author: Gus_263
title: Protector of the Matoran
review: Axonn is one of the best bionicle titans ever created. His colors (silver and red) are awesome. His axe, is very good builted and also his hands with fingers. The Axonn's Mask is very well designed, like his armors. He is smaller than Brutaka but is also cool, in playability, to do creations and is fun. Like the 2006 titans, Axonn also have the pneumatic system on the legs that works very well for titans. His feet are great and good builted, the legs and the arm are basically the same, doing that he looks like more strong. The other systems of the legs are great, doing that he really likes more an titan. I rate Axonn 5/5, a great set.

author: BrickBob09
title: Axonn- Best of the Bionicles
review:
In my opinion, Axonn is the greatest Bionicle set. From his huge axe down to his small fingers, every aspect of this set is amazing.

Parts

Axonn doesn't have many unique parts, but does have his mask and axe blades. The mask is great, especially the point at the top which makes him look taller. The axe blades are also very nice indeed, mainly because of the size which helps to portray Axonn's mighty strength. Most of the parts are either red or grey, making a good colour scheme.

Model

The model is generally very sturdy, although can be top heavy in some poses. However about from that, the set is really well designed. His armour fits together to create a great look and the sheer size makes him look very powerful.
One part of the amazing design is Axonn's hands. Not only are they huge, helping towards showing his strength, but he has actually fingers. To my knowledge, Axonn is only one of two Bionicles to feature poseable fingers. It may not sound like much but they really do make a difference when it comes down to posing or just playing,

Playability

Axonn is lots of fun to play with. He is highly poseable, has a fantastic design and just looks great among other Bionicles. The size of his axe gives a great playing aspect to him and makes him look like the strongest Bionicle you could find- you certainly wouldn't want to get on the wrong side of him!
I'm sure everyone from die-hard Bionicle collectors to the occasional LEGO buyer will enjoy playing with this set.

Price

At the original retail price this set was an absolute steal, but sadly now, due to the high demand of this set, second hand prices have shot through the roof. If you are lucky enough to find it at a bargain, don't hesitate to grab- before someone else does. You'll be kicking yourself if you let this one slip through your fingers!

Summary

I highly recommend this set. It's definitely my favourite Bionicle. He'll fit in with any Bionicle collection, big or small. He may not be the biggest Bionicle titian, but he's certainly the best.
